intro: Psychotria labatii, commonly known as the Madagascar nightshade, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white to purple flowers. The plant produces berries that are typically red when mature, containing seeds that are dispersed by animals. Psychotria labatii is often found in moist, shaded forest habitats, where it thrives in the understory of tropical rainforests. Its botanical features make it an important species in the ecological dynamics of its native environment.
